intro: Chassalia densifolia, commonly known as the denseleaf chassalia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its dense foliage and showy yellow flowers make it an ornamental plant in gardens. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
